tuv.seg: Having a baby or becoming a parent through birth, adoption or fostering is an exciting time and a major event in life
Is tréimhse chorraitheach í agus móreachtra i saol duine é saolú linbh nó bheith i do thuismitheoir den chéad uair trí bhreith, trí uchtú nó trí altramas
Family life in Ireland has changed significantly in the past few years and there are now many different types of parents and many different types of families
Tá athrú suntasach tagtha ar shaol an teaghlaigh in Éirinn le blianta beaga anuas agus anois tá cineálacha difriúla tuismitheoirí agus go leor cineálacha difriúla teaghlach
If you live in Ireland and will beome a parent through birth, your first step after discovering the pregnancy should be to visit your family doctor (GP)

Má tá tú i do chónaí in Éirinn agus má tá tú le bheith i do thuismitheoir trí bhreith, is é an chéad rud ar cheart duit a dhéanamh tar éis duit a fháil amach go bhfuil tú ag iompar clainne, ná dul chuig do dhochtúir teaghlaigh (LC)
Your doctor will confirm your pregnancy and you will receive important advice about your options and the health services available to you
Cinnteoidh an dochtúir go bhfuil tú ag iompar clainne agus gheobhaidh tú comhairle thábhachtach maidir le do roghanna agus na seirbhísí sláinte atá ar fáil duit
If this is an unplanned pregnancy, the Positive Options register will provide information on the wide range of agencies and groups offering free non-directional support and counselling services

Más toirceas neamhphleanáilte atá i gceist tabharfaidh clár Roghanna Dearfacha eolas duit faoin réimse leathan gníomhaireachtaí agus grúpaí a chuireann tacaíocht gan stiúrú agus comhairleoireacht ar fáil
If you or your partner will be giving birth in Ireland, you may avail of the Maternity and Infant Care Scheme, provided as part of the public health service
Má tá tú nó do pháirtí ag saolú linbh in Éirinn, d’fhéadfadh sibh leas a bhaint as an Chúraim Máithreachais agus Naíonáin, atá curtha ar fáil mar chuid den tseirbhís sláinte pobail
Here, the woman registers with a family doctor (GP), who will monitor her pregnancy throughout the term and refer her to a hospital for specialised checks
Sa chás seo, cláraíonn an bhean le dochtúir teaghlaigh (LC), a dhéanfaidh monatóireacht ar a toircheas i rith a théarma agus a chuirfidh chuig ospidéal í le haghaidh sainsheiceáil
Most women in Ireland choose to give birth in hospital, but there are other options available, including home birth
Roghnaíonn an chuid is mó de mhná in Éirinn breith in ospidéal, ach tá roghanna eile ar fáil, breith sa bhaile san áireamh
The infant mortality rate in Ireland is one of the lowest in the world and maternity healthcare is of a very high standard
Tá ráta báis leanaí in Éirinn ar cheann de na cinn is lú sa domhan agus tá caighdeán an-ard cúram sláinte máithreachais ann
If you will become a parent through adoption or fostering, you may like to read more detailed information on these topics here
Má tá tú le bheith i do thuismitheoir trí uchtú nó trí altramas, b’fhéidir go mba mhaith leat tuilleadh eolais faoi na ceisteanna seo a léamh anseo
If you are an unmarried parent or will be parenting alone, you should read through our information on custody, access, inheritance and maintenance
Más tuismitheoir neamhphósta thú nó má bheidh tú i do thuismitheoir aonair, ba cheart duit ár n-eolas faoi caomhnadh, rochtain, oidhreacht agus cothabháila léamh
You may also have an interest in the issue of legal guardianship
B’fhéidir go mbeidh spéis agat chomh maith i gcaomhnóireacht dlíthiúil
Becoming a parent and employment
Bheith i do thuismitheoir den chéad uair agus fostaíocht
The law in Ireland provides specific protection for pregnant employees
Tugann an dlí in Éirinn cosaint ar leith d’fhostaithe atá ag iompar clainne
You are entitled to a period of maternity leave from employment. You may also be entitled to Maternity Benefit
Mar shampla tá tú i dteideal am saor ón obair le pá chun freastal ar choinní dochtúra a bhaineann leis an toircheas
In addition you are entitled to paid time-off work to attend any medical visits associated with the pregnancy and to attend a certain number of ante-natal classes
Faoi láthair, áfach, níl tú i dteideal am saor ón obair le pá chun freastal ar ranganna réamhbheirthe
Both parents are also entitled to parental leave
Tá na tuismitheoirí araon i dteideal saoire tuismitheora chomh maith
Child Benefit is also payable to either parent (usually the mother) following the birth
Tá Sochar Linbh iníoctha chomh maith do ceachtar tuismitheora (de ghnáth an mháthair) tar éis na breithe
If you have become a parent through adoption, you are entitled to a period of adoptive leave from employment
Más tuismitheoir thú trí uchtú, tá tú i dteideal tréimhse saoire uchtaithe ón bhfostaíocht
If you have enough PRSI contributions you may qualify for Adoptive Benefit
Má tá méid áirithe ÁPSC (Árachas Sóisialach Pá-Choibhneasa) íoctha agat, d'fhéadfá cáiliú do Shochar Uchtála
New entitlements to paternity leave and Paternity Benefit are available in respect of children who are born or adopted from 1 September 2016 onwards
Tá teidlíochtaí nua saoire atharthachta agus Sochar Atharthachta ann i leith páistí a shaolaítear nó a uchtaítear ó 1 Meán Fómhair 2016 amach
If you have experienced a miscarriage or bereavement following the birth of your child, there are a number of voluntary and community agencies throughout Ireland that offer assistance and support

Má tá tú tar éis breith anabaí nó méala a fhulaingt tar éis bhreith do linbh, tá líon gníomhaireachtaí deonacha agus gníomhaireachtaí pobail ann ar fud na hÉireann a chuireann cúnamh agus tacaíocht ar fáil
Women in Ireland who have experienced a stillbirth are entitled to full maternity leave from employment
Tá mná in Éirinn a d’fulaing marbh-bhreith i dteideal saoire máithreachais iomlán ón obair
After your child has been born, you must register his/her birth within 3 months of the date of birth
Nuair a bheirtear do leanbh, ní mór duit a b(h)reith a chlárú laistigh de 3 mhí ón dáta breithe
Parents that have experienced a stillbirth can also register the birth
Féadfaidh tuismitheoirí breith a chlárú i ndiaidh marbh-bhreithe freisin
Registration may take place in the office of any Registrar of Births, Marriages and Deaths
Féadfar an clárú a dhéanamh in aon oifig leis an gCláraitheoir do Bhreitheanna, Póstaí agus Básanna
The law in Ireland makes presumptions about the paternity of children born to married couples
Déanann an dlí in Éirinn ceapadh maidir le hatharthacht leanaí a rugadh do lánúineacha pósta
This means the husband is presumed by law to be the father of the child
Ciallaíonn sé seo go gceaptar sa dlí gur páiste le fear chéile na máthar é/í an leanbh
The husband's name will be recorded on the birth certificate and he will acquire automatic guardianship of that child unless the mother states otherwise
Clárófar ainm an fhir chéile ar an teastas breithe agus gheobhaidh sé caomhnadh uathoibríoch an linbh sin muna ndéanann an mháthair ráiteas go bhfuil an scéal difriúil
Unmarried fathers are not automatical guardians of their own children and do not have an automatic right to have their names included on their children's birth certificates
Ní caomhnóirí uathoibríocha a leanaí féin iad aithreacha nach bhfuil pósta agus níl ceart uathoibríoch acu a n-ainmneacha a chur isteach ar theastais breithe a leanaí
Read about guardianship for unmarried fathers here
Léigh faoi caomhnadh d’aithreacha nach bhfuil pósta anseo
The public health service incorporates care for women and children following a birth in Ireland
Cuimsíonn an tseirbhís sláinte poiblí cúram do mhná agus leanaí tar éis breithe in Éirinn
This includes the Maternity and Infant Care Scheme, the public health nursing service, vaccinations and immunisations
Cuimsíonn sé seo an Scéim Chúraim Máithreachais agua Naíonáin, an tseirbhís altraí pobail service, vacsainí agus imdhíontaí
The social welfare system also provides assistance through the various channels including Health and Safety Benefit, One-Parent Family Payment, etc
Tugann an córas leasa shóisialaigh cúnamh chomh maith ar bhealaí éagsúla, san áireamh Sochar Sláinte agus Sábháilteachta, Íocaíocht do Theaghlaigh Aontuismitheora, agus araile
Choosing the right care for your child can be a difficult decision
Is rud deacair é cinneadh ceart a dhéanamh maidir le cúram do linbh
There is a wide range of options including day nurseries, childminders, paygroups, etc
Is iomaí rogha atá ann, lena n-áirítear naíonraí, feighlithe leanaí, grúpaí súgartha, is araile
Your choice will depend on what your needs are
Braithfidh do chinneadh ar do riachtanais féin
In January 2010 an Early Childhood Care and Education (ECCE) Scheme was introduced which aims to provide a free year of early childhood care and education for children of pre-school age

Tugadh isteach an an Scéim um Chúram agus Oideachas na Luath-Óige in Eanáir 2010 a bhfuil sé d’aidhm aige bliain chúraim agus oideachais luath-óige a sholáthar saor in aisce do leanaí atá in aois na réamhscolaíochta
Since 1997, nurseries, playgroups and crèches providing day care for children under 6 years in Ireland have to meet certain regulations
Ó 1997, caithfidh naonraí, grúpaí spraoi agus naíolanna atá ag cur cúram lae ar fáil do leanaí faoi 6 bliana in Éirinn rialacháin áirithe a chomhlíonadh
Read about the regulation of pre-school childcare places in Ireland here
Léigh tuilleadh faoi rialachán áiteanna cúram léanaí réamhscoile in Éirinn anseo
Registered childcare providers must be notified to the Child and Family Agency and inspected by it
Caithfear don Ghníomhaireacht um Leanaí agus an Teaghlach a chur ar an eolas faoi sholáthraithe chúram leanaí cláraithe agus caithfidh siad cigireacht a dhéanamh orthu
The childcare facility must be registered with either the National Childminding Association of Ireland or the National Children's Nurseries Association
Ní foláir don áis um chúram leanaí a bheith cláraithe le Cumann Náisiúnta Chúram Leanaí na hÉireannnó an Cumann Náisiúnta Naíolanna Leanaí
County Childcare Committees have been assigned to advance the provision of child care services within your area. Check with your local authority for more information on your local Committee
Dáileadh Coistí Contae Chúram Leanaí chun forálacha chúram leanaí i do cheantar a chur chun cinn Téigh i dteagmháil le d’údarás áitiúil chun tuilleadh eolais a fháil faoi do choiste áitiúil
